newsitem.title: TAIWAN: China Development Jan-April net surges.
newsitem.headline: China Development Jan-April net surges.

text.p: China Development Corp, one of Taiwan's leading venture capital and investment firms, said on Thursday its January-April 1996 net profit surged 193 percent to T$2.74 billion from T$935 million a year earlier.
A company statement attributed the surge to much higher income and well controlled cost. It did not elaborate.
January-April turnover surged 89.2 percent to T$2.833 billion from T$1.497 billion a year earlier, the statement said.
In April, turnover rose 49.8 percent to T$767.4 million from T$512.4 million a year earlier, it said.

It also listed turnover for its trust funds, with January-April sales leaping 133.5 percent to T$1.145 billion from T$490.5 million. April trust fund turnover rose 98.1 percent to T$291 million from T$147 million.
As of March 31, China Development had invested in 154 companies with a total investment of T$20.93 billion, it said.

The firm's top three investment targets are the semiconductor industry, electronic and electrical appliance industry, and computer and telecommunications, which accounted for 22.88 percent, 12.66 percent and 11.44 percent, respectively, of total investment.
